Commands#

All#

Shows all content on the bkmks database.

bkmk.all.all(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any) → Any#

Invoked as bkall. With no arguments, it prints all content on the database.

Options:

-n

Number of latest entries to show. Prints ‘n’ amount of new entries, thusly:

bkall -n 4

Delete#

Command line version of the delete function bookmarks.

bkmk.delete.delete(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any) → Any#

Function that deletes one, several or range of entries in the ‘bkmks’ database.

You can call it with bkdlt, and use it in the following form:

  1. Delete non sequential entries. Surround the ids with quotation marks and separate them with a comma:

    bkdlt '435,436'

  2. Delete sequential entries. Envelop first and last ids with quotation marks and separate them with a dash:

    bkdlt '437-439'

    You may include spaces, but they’ll be deleted by the application.

  3. Delete single entry. Write the id surrounded by quotation marks:

    bkdlt 66

Search#

Command line implementation of the ‘search’ function in ‘bkmks’.

bkmk.search.show_results()[source]#

Outputs the search query results as ascii tables.

bkmk.search.db_call(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any) → Any#

Accepts only one string which is the search query.

Doesn’t have options so use only the bksrch command followed by the string query.

Outputs a pickle file, srch.bin and calls the show_results function.

Update#

Command line version of the ‘update’ function for bkmks.

bkmk.update.update(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any) → Any#

Called with bkupdt.

Options:

-i

Integer with the id value of the line we want to update.

-c

String of the column’s name we want to update.

-u

Text that you want to change. it’s a prompt. So just insert the other options and press Enter to access it.

Add#

Command line version for adding bookmarks to bkmks.

bkmk.add.add(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any) → Any#

All information is gathered through cli options. The command is bkadd.

Options:

-t

Insert title of bookmark.

-c

Insert comment to bookmark. The program will automatically open a prompt for you to write. Just enter all other values, press Enter and the prompt will appear.

-l

Insert URL of bookmark.

-k

Insert up to three keywords.
